description.narrative: (Turkmenistan): USAID's Governance Support Program strengthens effectiveness and transparency of the governance sector in Turkmenistan through improved public administration and bolstered policy development and lawmaking. With FY 2020 funds, the Governance Support Program will support increased information sharing among Turkmen governance institutions and develop effective policies and legislation through public engagement. Beyond capacity development for civil servants, the activity will focus on several thematic areas in relation to governance: electronic governance, health related electronic monitoring systems, water resource management, Rights of Persons with Disabilities to work, land registry development, and solid waste management. This will include developing training manuals, providing legal consultations, developing courses for civil servants and NGOs, and analyzing the implementation of laws and regulations such as Ecological Audit, the Anti-Corruption Law, the Law on Ecological Expertise, the Law on Ethics, the Law on Child Rights, and others. The Governance Support Program will also improve the sustainability and effectiveness of civil society organizations to operate independently through the development of entrepreneurial skills and improvement of their communication with the government and the private sector. By increasing the capacity of the Government of Turkmenistan and sharing with its civil service the American democratic model, USAID is helping to build on the existing bilateral relationship to advance shared interests and articulating America's vision per National Security Strategy Pillar III. This activity will also support both Integrated Country Strategy (ICS) objective 3.2 and the U.S. Strategy for Central Asia objective 5 by sharing best practices to improve governance, delivery of social services, and civic participation, thus addressing the Turkmen Government Effectiveness in its journey to self-reliance.
